title: Argentine banana growers say imports hurting them
description:
(2 Aug 2017) Banana growers were giving away their produce to people in Buenos Aires on Wednesday as part of a demonstration over trading conditions.
The farmers organised the protest to demand government measures against the import of foreign bananas and policies to boost their sector.
Even though one kilo of bananas can cost up to 30 pesos at a grocery store local producers said that they are paid between 1 and 1.20 peso per kilo.
Argentine bananas are produced in the northern provinces of Salta, Jujuy and Formosa.
According to the organisers, a total of thirty thousand kilos of bananas were given away during the "bananazo" action.
Those who lined the Plaza de Mayo square to receive bananas voiced their support for the producers, complaining about the high prices of fruit caused by the country's inflation.
